Posted By: Xycolian (10/1/2012 11:53:24 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Let me just say, I love this card. Especially in standard. I'm running 3x of him mainboard in my Grixis Control and he's a threat to any control deck. In the blink of an eye, he can turn into a very aggressive creature or an impressive blocker, only having to exile a flashbacked desperate ravings during an emergency to make him a 3/4. He's a solid one drop that blocks 1/1 creatures all day, can fight Garruk Relentless easily, and can turn countered instant/sorcery spells into fuel. Your opponent will [Think Twice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Think Twice) before countering your instants and sorceries. He's a very viable alternative to Delver. He may not have evasion, but he can definitely be a threat.
posts.html:

He's a solid one drop that blocks 1/1 creatures all day, can fight Garruk Relentless easily, and can turn countered instant/sorcery spells into fuel. Your opponent will Think Twice before countering your instants and sorceries. He's a very viable alternative to Delver. He may not have evasion, but he can definitely be a threat.

posts.post_content:
I think the Izzet are the heroes of RTR block.  
  
I think there is some dreadful menace from Phyrexia coming, and Niv-Mizzet, one of the few Planar-bound living beings actually aware of a Multiverse, is preparing the Izzet for War with Mirrodin. I think they're going to be compleately curb-stomped.  
  
But they're still going to fight.  
  
Because if they can't Protect the Guildpact, you can be damned well sure they'll AVENGE IT.
